name: Chabuca Granda
description:
'''María Isabel Granda Larco''' (3 September 1920 – 8 March 1983), better known as '''Chabuca Granda''', was a Peruvian singer and composer. She created and interpreted a vast number of [[Creole Waltz|Criollo waltzes]] with [[Afro-Peruvian]] rhythms. 

Granda's "[[La flor de la canela]]", "[[José Antonio (song)|José Antonio]]", "[[El puente de los suspiros (song)|El puente de los suspiros]]", and "[[Fina estampa (song)|Fina estampa]]" helped the singer receive international recognition. She has influenced various Peruvian artists such as [[Susana Baca]], [[Eva Ayllón]], [[Gian Marco]] and [[Juan Diego Flórez]].

In 2017, her work was declared a ''[[Cultural heritage of Peru|Cultural Heritage of the Nation]]'' and in 2019, the Peruvian government posthumously awarded her the highest national honor, the [[Order of the Sun of Peru|Order of the Sun]].
